data.meta_description: Pitt‚Äôs Doctor of Occupational Therapy (OTD) program can lead to a variety of OT careers! Check out what future career Christie Cyktor (OTD '24) is planning to‚Ä¶
data.text:
U.S. News & World Report has ranked the Program in Occupational Therapy third in the nation. The ranking is based on the results of peer assessment surveys sent to deans and is a reflection of the dedication of our faculty, staff and clinicians in advancing our vision to lead innovation for barrier-free living. This distinction also recognizes the quality of our students and their future impact on the profession. View the complete ranking: https://ow.ly/xiqn50Rbj69 #WashUOT #TopThree #OTEducation

This week marks OT week, a profession that we as a business are very passionate about. We‚Äôre often asked, ‚ÄúWhat is Occupational Therapy?‚Äù, so weeks like these that raise awareness about the hard work that OTs do are incredibly important. This animation, created by the Royal College of Occupational Therapists, is designed to help more people understand what occupations are and why they are essential to living. Watch here: https://lnkd.in/eZ2ZCD6d #OTWeek23

April is Occupational Therapy month. Let's use this month to get the word out as to what you amazing clinicians do! For one because people need to realize your value in their recovery! But selfishly it would also save me 2 minutes with every evaluation explaining what it is you do and what the differences are...üòâ (don't worry I talk you up big time). In all seriousness thank you for what you do. One of the best parts of working in a snf is being able to collaborate with you all. Shout out to Melinda Hensler, MS, OTR/L for being the best OT partner a guy could ask for over the last too many years to count! #occupationaltherapy #otmonth #physicaltherapy #givingthanks

October is National Occupational Therapy month. Let's take a moment to recognize and applaud the Occupational Therapy Department. These remarkable individuals are an integral part of the Intensive Therapy/Rehabilitation Services program at Perth and Smiths Falls District Hospital, and this month, we celebrate their exceptional contribution. What is occupational therapy? It is a form of healthcare that addresses barriers that prevent individuals from performing activities they enjoy. Occupational therapists assist with daily living tasks such as dressing and eating, as well as being productive in work, school, or community settings. Moreover, they help individuals participate in leisure activities such as sports, gardening, and social events, emphasizing the importance of a holistic approach. #OccupationalTherapy #HealthcareJobs #EmployeeRecognition #OSOT2023 #CAOT

You heard it here first, #EKU is home to one of the best Occupational Therapy programs in the nation! Boasting a 99% graduation rate since 2020, we‚Äôre proud to be sending out well-trained professionals to meet the needs of communities across Kentucky. You can read more about the program and learn the exact ranking in the article below! ü©πüè• üîó: https://lnkd.in/esfRGTBP

Explaining occupational therapy to your loved ones can be a daunting task. But worry not, I came through one of the best explanations out there! Check out this informative video that covers all the essential areas of occupational therapy in easy-to-understand layman terms. Hit the spot üéØ and enlight your friends and family with your newfound knowledge! #occupationaltherapy #healthcare #healthscience
